intro: Prinos lanceolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf prinos, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers during the summer months. Prinos lanceolatus is typically found in shrubland and coastal habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some regions for horticultural purposes.
